reviewText:
Early Access Review

Event Horizon is I would say a cross between Star Control and Space invaders/asteroid that I used to play when I was a kid, ts actually quite addictive!

You start off with a main vessel and 3 other ships, a scout ship, a 'thingy' (i have no idea what it was) and a cruiser type ship. Each have their own weapons systems and shield capabilities.

A quick menu jump to the star map and you get a feel for how big this game will be, there are tons and tons of stars to visit. The only problem is that every star you visit involves a fight. In the 40 odd minutes I played I had about 6 battles. These were with ships of a similar class to mine but some had upgrades. Travelling to new star systems and then again within that system to planets and stations is done by clicking the star/station/planet you want to visit.

In most systems there are at least a couple of planets but at this time the exploration of planets is not included so despite there being a menu option to explore them... you cant. TRUST ME I HAVE TRIED!

Battles take the form of asteroid style gameplay. Fire your weapon at the enemy and try to hit them to cause them damage. Most evenly matched ships took about 6 or so hits to kill, you can then collect parts and fuel and credits.
Overall I like the idea of the game, it will become repetitive and probably a little boring but ship upgrades and new systems to explore may keep you wanting more. For me its a good one to play whilst the wife watches crap on TV!

Pro's:
Runs well on a laptop!
Game has a tutorial (takes about 4 seconds to complete)
Huge skill/upgrade tree

Cons
Repetitive gameplay
Non existent story
Battles quickly become hard
voteText: 12 of 15 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I purchased this as part of a bundle; actually, this game wound up being the sole reason I purchased it from IndieGala. I decided to play it a bit before I went to bed, and, all I can say is...

Jesus Christ, this is fun. The combat is exciting, the sensation of building something greater is ever-present, and the mechanics seem complex and nuanced.

I'll update my review if anything changes as I play the game more, but, all the game really needs, right now, aside from the quests and the storyline the developer has pledged to create, is a REAL tutorial. Right now, there's a quick combat tutorial that allows one to test new weapons, ship configurations, et cetera, without any risk - brilliant on its own, but...

Honestly, I have no idea if I'm ever playing the game correctly. Like, what are those icons in the beginning of the customization section? When do I get to research technologies? Can I not explore any planets, yet, or, am I missing something?

There are definitely some features missing, but, the base game is definitely worth it, as is. Highly recommended.

Very addictive and complex game.

I will go straight to the facts;):

Pros:

+ Space rpg.
+ Lots of ships.
+ Weapons, upgrades, modules, which can be purchase, looted and found on the ships and then unlocked and installed in our destroyers.
+ Random loot of varying quality.
+ Fractions with their own technologies and ships.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Let's cut to the chase, shall we?
Event Horizon is one hell of a game.

I could end the review there, but people would likely want a little more than that. Back when this game was still in Greenlight, I had downloaded the demo, as I had played it on Android, so I really have about 60-70 hours Idk.

Fly around to different star systems, battle ships, get money, buy new ships, battle more ships, buy more parts for your ships, customize your ships,  put your ships on your shipping wall,  explore planets, get resources from the planets, most of which you'll just sell to get more money to buy more ♥♥♥♥ for your ships. Attempt to destroy some flagships AND THEN GET YOUR ♥♥♥ WHOOPED BY THOR.

10 Factions - Go to each faction's territory and duke it out with their ships. Earn research stars, research faction-specific technologies, unlock new ones. Capture their base in order to use it's workshop, and to construct their technology.

Pros:

-Space.
-Ship to ship combat.
-Very customizable ships.
-Combat is fun and enjoyable.
-Faction territory is very common, you won't be wandering around too much.
-There are no major bugs to report.
-It is actually quite true that there are millions of stars; I think EH's universe might be infinite.
-Did I mention space?

Cons:
-Some technologies are un-researchable.
-No storyline, although I expect one will be added soon. I always have my headcanon ;)
-There can be a lot of grinding, if you're not a fan of grinding.
-Thor is a ♥♥♥♥♥.
-Will consume your very soul with it's addictiveness

TL;DR - This game is awesome and you should buy it.

Did I mention there was space?

8.3/10

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Awesome and fun game. My video and full reviews can be found by following the links below. Here's the short version.....

If you like retro space war games, but with way more depth, then this is an excellent game. Never played any of these old school games? No problem, pick this up and have fun as well. It has (limited) exploration, good game depth, lot's of spaceships, great battles, strategy, and nice gameplay mechanics. The upgrades and technologies available are impressive. Even in it's current state, which is way better then I expected, it's worth the price tag without a doubt. It is more completed then expected. You get a good game that can only get better. It gets an 8 out of 10 from me without hesitation!

Pure Gameplay video: https://youtu.be/seG8-Qii8hU

Full English review: http://grandpagaming.blogspot.nl/2016/05/event-horizon-english-and-dutch-review.html

Volledige Nederlands Review: http://grandpagaming.blogspot.nl/2016/05/event-horizon-review-nederlands.html

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Don't buy this yet, unless like me you love exploration and ship customization.

There is enough of the game working for you to enjoy it. The customization options are huge, but the controls are finicky, and its lacking in a decent tutorial and tooltips, these are the things I'm hoping EA will add.

Early Access Review

Very addictive as is! If you take a moment to learn it. The planet side stuff def needs work. I can see it was meant for mobile but with tweaks and adjustments this could be a great little PC gem.

I've had tons of entertainment so far just trying to unlock stuff and exploring the systems. The high cost of ships and items is a little daunting with how much you need to grind to get them then unlock their premade structure (that could use some work). Better explanations of weapon sizes and slots would be nice also.

Then again it is early access and the dev is looking for feedback so lets do just that! Instead of the one neg review I saw posted like 3 days ago... that person sounds like they got stuck at the start menu because there's quite a bit to do as is not just a few buggy" screens lol"
